definition[0]: to make someone do something by annoying or encouraging them until they do it
example[0]: Kathy goaded him into telling her what he had done.
example[1]: They goaded him on with insults.
definition[1]: to push animals ahead of you with a sharp stick
definition[2]: something that forces someone to do something
example[2]: The offer of economic aid was a goad to political change.
definition[3]: a sharp stick for making animals move forward
